III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.4109 Program statement.
Section Rule 109. (1) An institution shall have and follow a current
Description written program statement which specifically addresses all of
the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
1

residents’ needs, implementation of treatment plans,
and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Therapist made inappropriate comments to Youth A regarding a
personal medical procedure.
Investigation The complainant for this investigation was anonymous, so no
further information was gathered.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/21/2023 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit at the facility. She stated that there was never a
conversation with Therapist that involved any inappropriate topics.
Youth A stated that she spoke with Therapist within the past week
about how he was going to be out on a leave and might miss
some sessions with her, but there were no specifics about why he
was going to be on a leave that were shared. Youth A stated that
Staff 1 was recently in a session with her and Therapist but was
not sure if that involved a quick conversation about the therapist
being out on a leave. Youth A stated that there has never been a
time when Therapist shared any inappropriate information about
himself to her, nor was she aware of any details as to why he was
out on a medical leave. She stated she felt safe with him and that
he was helpful to her in his capacity.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 12/05/2023. She
stated that she has spent a considerable amount of time with
Youth A as a 1:1 staff. Staff 1 stated that she was sitting in for
part of a session recently between Youth A and Therapist on the
day before the Labor Day holiday. Staff 1 recalled that Therapist
told Youth A that he was going to miss their next session together
because he was going on a leave for a medical procedure. Staff 1
recalled Therapist thought he would be back at work after that, but
was not sure and that he stated to Youth A that he would make
sure she knew when their next session would be. Staff 1 recalled
Youth A responding with an inappropriate question back to Staff 1,
something about if the procedure was about STDs or a vagina.
Staff 1 stated that she attempted to redirect Youth A. Staff 1
recalled Therapist responded he was having a medical procedure
in an “inappropriate area.” Staff 1 recalled Therapist mentioned
something about having some discomfort as a reason why he was
having a procedure. Staff 1 stated that the only other aspect of
the conversation she recalled was that Therapist motioned in front
of his crotch as he talked about his upcoming medical procedure.
Staff 1 noted that she has never seen Therapist be inappropriate
with any youth or staff in her time working with him. She has
2

spent a considerable amount of time working with Youth A and
Youth A is often inappropriate with other youth and staff.
Therapist was interviewed over video on 12/13/2023. He stated
that he has recently returned from a brief medical leave and that
he is no longer assigned to work with Youth A. Therapist recalled
a conversation with Youth A the day prior to his medical leave
beginning. He stated Staff 1 was in the room with him and Youth
A because she was acting as the 1:1 staff with Youth A. Therapist
recalled intentionally telling Youth A that he was going to miss a
session with her because she has struggled in the past with
unpredictability. Therapist stated that he did not give Youth A any
details on why he was having a procedure. He recalled that Youth
A asked him if he was “having a vagina implanted.” Therapist
stated back to Youth A that was not the case. He also recalled
telling her that the procedure was a sensitive topic and it did not
need to be discussed. Therapist believed that Youth A also asked
him something about the procedure having to do with STDs.
Therapist recalled that he may have said something to Youth A
about having discomfort or pain and that being a reason for
needing medical attention, but no other details were disclosed to
Youth A. He did not believe he made reference to where a
procedure was occurring on his body. Therapist denied making
any reference or motion to his crotch in this conversation with
Youth A. Therapist recalled being able to redirect the
conversation. Therapist was not sure if he documented their
conversation. He stated that he has witnessed Youth A be
inappropriate with other youth and staff on many occasions, and
that is a component of her treatment needs.
Documents reviewed:
• No discipline noted in the personnel file for Therapist.
• “Chart Notes” documentation for Youth A on 11/09/2023
was reviewed. Entries for that date regarding interactions
with Youth A were entered by Staff 1 and the Therapist but
no mention was made of the alleged conversation between
Youth A and Therapist.
• Facility policy titled “Employee - Resident Relationships”
dated 05/18/2022 was reviewed. This policy stated “Staff
members are expected to refrain from sharing details of
their personal lives with residents.”
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff and documentation
reviewed, sufficient evidence was not found that a rule violation
occurred in the interaction between Youth A and Therapist on
11/09/2023.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
